title: The Elder Scrolls Online
notes: FPS is not stable, there are twitchings. In general, playable. No problems with the interface or artifacts. Prevent the fall of FPS.
Worked just fine after adding the steam launch parameters 'PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%'
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes: FPS not so "smooth" like when it running in Windows, but seems stable and very good playable. Will do a long-term test. I also used the lauchoptions: PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 mesa_glthread=true vblank_mode=0 %command%
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes: Works fine - Adding dxd10 and dxd11 into wine-tricks fixes black texture bug - NON-Steam game version. - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v6A5CN62P1c&
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes: Note I don't own the steam version but still using Proton by itself via this guide: https://forums.elderscrollsonline.com/en/discussion/433344/elder-scroll-online-in-linux-using-proton-non-steam-version/p1 Much the same fixes as mentioned are required to launch. Game is very playable only far lower FPS than usual for DXVK. That said FPS during fights is strangely reasonable, only walking around the world & towns is much lower.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes: Used the Proton fix and works flawlessly.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-34-generic, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: runs about as well as it does on windows
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes:
Works fine, low fps compared to native windows - as expected. To run the game without esync disabled (and subsequently gain some fps) one has to increase the open file limit on the system to something above 4096 (I'm uncertain about how much)

Other remarks:
Runs between 50 to 20 (when moving) in more demanding areas with Ultra-High setting. On High it varies from 80 to 23-ish fps.
The game is probably bottlenecked by not running llvm 7 or greater, and shader limits (better in DXVK 0.80 - not integrated into proton yet)
Make sure the game runs on an ext4 file system as well (as all proton games should)
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 570 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.9-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: Works great with about 25FPS average, probably more when on a better Machine than a seven year old Laptop with eGPU.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes: unsupported directx version.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes: For those that don't know, add "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%" to launch options if your game is going to black screen after Bethesda logo.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes:
Needs 'PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%' to launch options.
Suffers performance penalty which can be mitigated by lowering graphics fidelity. Increased performance penalty in cities.

Have played over 500 hours on upstream wine+dxvk.

There was a memory leak when running with upstream wine. Haven't tested yet on proton/steamplay.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 560 Series (POLARIS11, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-36-generic, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Running game without Launch options once installed. Increased limit of Open File Limits to 500000 through terminal. Turned off minor graphics enhancements (Bloom, Sun Rays, VSYNC, Anti-Aliasing) Game runs well with minor frame drops. I am only seeing major frame drops now in cities that are heavily populated by others. Even then is much better than before.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes: It was necessary to disable esync to run the game without crashing. Performance is not perfect, but it is playable. No other issues observed.

title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes: There's a few fps drops but, stuttering is basically gone, the game run really good out of the box, there's no need for other configuration if you're using the 396.54.09 drivers.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes: Latest 3.16-2 Beta (which includes DXVK 0.90) and Vulkan dev drivers, most stutters gone and able to achieve a solid framerate above 60 outside towns with shadows on high, reflections low & 65 view distance. Still much lower fps than on Windows but it's gone from unplayable to very playable. One small issue is the launcher links don't work in the current Proton prefix unless you set it to xp (which the game needs Win 7), steam overlay can launch links i.e. store in game.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon HD 7800 Series (PITCAIRN, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.14-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 7.0.0)
notes: Had to switch to amdgpu drivers. Wouldn't work without PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 mesa_glthread=true vblank_mode=0 %command% launch command. I could play smoothly on High when I was using a wc. Currently can play at medium experiencing little problems.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.9-92.current, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: Works perfectly fine after disabling Esync. Also make sure to close the launcher after pressing play for better performance, leaving the launcher open will cause a performance impact.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online

notes: This game would be a platinum if it wasn't for the fact you have to disable esync for your very first launch of the game. Subsequent playing sessions don't require this tweak anymore. The game itself works perfectly otherwise.
title: The Elder Scrolls® Online
